snippet: Prosecutors provisionally dropped murder charges against the 270 miners who had been accused of killing 34 of their own colleagues when the police opened fire on them during a strike.
abstract: Prosecutors provisionally drop murder charges against 270 jailed miners who had been accused of killing 34 of their own colleagues when police opened fire on them during an illegal strike; public outrage had grown after the charges of murder were announced under an obscure legal doctrine known as common purpose, frequently used in the waning days of apartheid.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors provisionally dropped murder charges against the 270 miners who had been accused of killing 34 of their own colleagues when the police opened fire on them during a strike.

headline.main: South Africa Lifts Charges of Murder in Mine Strike
headline.print_headline: South Africa Lifts Charges Of Murder In Mine Strike
